body: @lostb1t have you got time to take a look at this?

As mentioned in the docs. Advanced data protection is not supported.

Disable and try again (make sure to reauthenticate)

Got it. On iPhone > Settings > Apple Account > iCloud > 'Advanced Data Protection' was ON.
--> click 'Turn Off Advanced Data Protection'.

Then, on the Ubuntu system, I removed the remote entry.

I recreated the icloud entry. `rclone ls yourremote` fails, also after a previous `rclone config reconnect yourremote`.

Here's the logfile output.
```
*redacted*@ubuntu:~$ rclone lsd *redacted*: --dump=headers --retries=1

2025/01/15 14:57:29 NOTICE: Failed to lsd with 2 errors: last error was: HTTP error 423 (423 Locked) returned body: "{\"requestUUID\":\"8*redacted*\",\"errorReason\":\"Missing PCS cookies from the request\",\"errorCode\":423}"
```

Is turning off Apple iCloud data protection asynchronous in the meaning of waiting afterwards e.g. 24 hours?

yeah i would give it some time to propagate.

Just make sure to recreate the config entry (there should be no token or cookie set)

Thanks for your insight @lostb1t - perhaps we need a troubleshooting section in the docs. Maybe something like this?

Please correct any mis-understandings in the below!

## Troubleshooting

### Missing PCS cookies from the request

This means you have Advanced data protection turned on. This is not supported at the moment. If you want to use rclone you will have to turn it off (WHERE?).  You should then run `rclone reconnect remote:`.

This doesn't take effect immediately - you may need to wait a few hours or a day before you can get rclone to work - keep running `rclone reconnect remote:` until rclone functions properly.

@ncw If my memory serves me correct i think we can see when ADP is enabled by on authentication. And its on my todo to create a check and proper error message for it

and yeah some extra info to the readme doesn't hurt

I added it yesterday and it authenticated and 2fa'd just fine, but i didn't realize at the time that it wouldn't work with advanced data protection. I disable ADP and recreated the connection but ever since I have been getting this error:

```
rclone config reconnect icloud:
Error: HTTP error 400 (400 Bad Request) returned body: "{\"success\":false,\"error\":\"Invalid Session Token\"}"
Usage:
  rclone config reconnect remote: [flags]

Flags:
  -h, --help   help for reconnect

Use "rclone [command] --help" for more information about a command.
Use "rclone help flags" for to see the global flags.
Use "rclone help backends" for a list of supported services.

2025/01/15 08:05:38 NOTICE: Fatal error: HTTP error 400 (400 Bad Request) returned body: "{\"success\":false,\"error\":\"Invalid Session Token\"}"
```

I remade it multiple times, I switched from the brew release to the conda release, I waited a day and remade it and now no matter what I do it gives me this error. Any ideas?

@xrishox make sure there are no token or cooky fields in the config before rauthenticatiins

and to check: app passwords are not supported use username/password

On iPhone, Settings > Apple Account > iCloud > 'Access iCloud Data on the Web' must be ON, and 'Advanced Data Protection' OFF.
After I recreated the icloud entry, `rclone ls <yourremote>:` works flawlessly. The error 423 is gone.
In the docs, yes, indeed it would be helpful to mention both settings.

The following directories are visible with `rclone lsd <yourremote>:`
- Downloads
- Pages
- Shortcuts

Does someone know how to make Photos and Movies eligible as well?

To the rclone developers: Awesome product!

The issue with error 400 must be (yet) another constellation as it is described with `invalid session token`.

issue.title: iclouddrive: add notes on ADP and Missing PCS cookies

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Here are some docs to help the users out with  #8310

Please can you take a quick look @lostb1t and @dcasota - thank you!

body: Do we think there's any hope to be able to support ADP? I'm a little unsure on the topic myself. :)

> Do we think there's any hope to be able to support ADP? I'm a little unsure on the topic myself. :)

It's technically possible, if thats what you are asking.
Ah ok, what would be required to know to support it? I wouldn't mind contributing to said patch myself~

if my memory servers correct you have to request access to a service (drive in this case) explicitly during authentication.

i know https://github.com/foxt/icloud.js supports it so you might wanna start there.

ofcourse this is based on the web api so reverse engineering is with that is another approach
Time to reverse engineer icloud api, I'll report back later xD
